RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OUR GREAT NOTION pressured the pace from the three path, drew to even terms at the quarter pole but dropped back approaching the top of the stretch, dug in leaving the eighth pole and took over late yards. ESSENTIAL MAGIC exchanged contact with Xtended Streak leaving the gate then pressured the pace inside, took the lead at the rail approaching the quarter pole, dueled clear into the lane but was caught flattening stride late yards. FOXY SISTA came in and made contact with Xtended Streak leaving the gate then engaged in close chase through the backstretch, dueled to near even terms past the quarter pole then flattened stride inside the sixteenth pole. SHEWEARSSTILETTOS chased outside, rounded the turn about the five path and ran evenly in the stretch. PHANTOM QUEEN was hustled to the front approaching the seven sixteenths pole and set a pressured pace, was met past the five sixteenths pole and dropped back from between horses leaving the quarter, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. XTENDED STREAK became fractious in the gate, was jostled on the chute then gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and weakened in the lane. ITSUPTOME briefly gave chase, showed little response past the five sixteenths pole and was taken in hand at that point.

ENTRY.NAME: Our Great Notion
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,even terms 1/4,dug in lane,up near wire, clear

ENTRY.NAME: Essential Magic
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Shewearsstilettos
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 20700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allow ed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WINDSOR'S PLAY took over and moved to the inside to set a pressured pace, contested the advantage near the rail on the turn, raced clear into the lane and held on well under steady handling. CHEROKEE CASTLE engaged in close chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. REAL APPEAL chased through the backstretch, raced in range of the lead in the four path of the turn and finished well in the stretch duel for third. FIFTY GRAY SHADES pressured the pace through the backstretch but drifted on the turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. DIVA ROSE gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. GLOBAL EMPRESS chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. ELLIES AT WINDSOR came away awkwardly and veered outward, gave chase outside, raced in the five path of the turn and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Windsor's Play
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,edge rail turn,clear 1/8,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Ellies At Windsor
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward,veered out break,chased,5p turn,little in lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 14100. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE NOVEMBER 19, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 19 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered F or $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRETCH THE TRUTH accelerated toward contention, took the nod at the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, contested the rail on the turn and held on under steady handling. WIDGET FACTORY gave chase, raced close in the three path on the turn then dueled through the stretch to share second. NO FOOLING DUDE had a brief early lead then pressured the pace leaving the three eighths pole, contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn, dug in through the stretch and held on to share second. LUCKYTOBEINAMERICA chased the early pace outside, saved ground on the turn and finished evenly to passe rivals. WIZARD OF ODDS chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened later yards. CHAMBO chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path, eased out toward the top of the lane but flattened stride the final sixteenth. BETTER BOOGIE hopped at the break then gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the five path and showed little in the stretch. GAMING JACK chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path, angled out toward the eighth pole and showed little in the lane. TANELEER gave chase then faded in the four path on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Stretch the Truth
ENTRY.COMMENT: up 3/8,set pressured pace,rail turn,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: dh-No Fooling Dude
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Conrad Randall R

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 105. Allowance Purse 34800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 19 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 19 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In W eight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FREE SAILIN bobbled leaving the gate but closed to the lead approaching the three quarter pole and moved to the inside on the first turn, came under pressure past the three eighths pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled to draw clear mid-stretch. FANCY CONCHO rated close off the rail, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and raced in range at the rail on the far turn, then dug in under steady encouragement to take second the final yards. NICO settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn but relented second in the final yards. SOCIAL CHIC rounded the opening turn about the four path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. NO CHANGE rated close inside, challenged leaving the three eighths pole and raced close off the rail on the far turn, but dropped back approaching the head of the lane and flattened in the lane. COMMAND THE CAT saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole but showed little response. ISHIHARA rounded the first turn about the five path and never factored. HERO'S MAN settled in the three path the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: No Change
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,challenged 3/8,off rail turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Nico
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 3/8,close 2d far turn,relented 2nd late yards

ENTRY.NAME: Free Sailin
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled break,rated pace inside,edge rail turn,cleared 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Allowance Purse 30500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Apri l 19 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 19 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOLDEN G settled off the pace, started a bid leaving the five sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the turn, dug in leaving the turn and took the nod in the final stride. DAY THE MUSIC DIED took the lead leaving the chute and rated the pace, came under pressure at the quarter pole, dug in under steady handling leaving the turn but gave up the nod under the wire. SETTLEMENT DATE chased, raced at the rail on the turn and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. DAN THE MAN CAN chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn, eased outward approaching the eighth pole and ran evenly in the lane. REMYS SHOWTIME broke a step slow, gave chase from the half mile pole, raced in the four path on the turn and had little left. TOLLER gave chase and raced off the rail on the turn. MOJAC KAT saved ground. HAGGERSDALE gave chase from well back and rounded the turn about the four path.

ENTRY.NAME: Golden G
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace,bid 5/16,4p turn,nod final stride

ENTRY.NAME: Dan the Man Can
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Day the Music Died
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured 1/4,steady urging lane,ceded nod wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 70. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RAGTIME RICHES rated close inside on the first turn, advanced from the three eighths pole and dueled to the lead two deep midway on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn and moved clear later yards. LUNAR MISSION settled in the two and three paths on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, steadily improved in the three path on the far turn and dug in through the lane to take second the final yards. CAIRO BREEZE stalked three wide on the first turn, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole and took a brief lead toward the five sixteenths, was met at the rail midway on the far turn, remained close through the upper stretch but flattened inside the sixteenth pole. ICETECA stumbled at the break and saved ground, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and passed rivals. BOOYAH raced with the pace inside, was met approaching the five sixteenths pole and gave chase from that point, but dropped back toward the quarter and flattened near the rail on the far turn. MILLBANK MAN stalked two deep into the first turn, gave chase approaching the half mile pole but weakened at the rail into the far turn. ONLY GET'N BETTER raced well back inside on the first turn and could only improve his position. MAJOR NELSON veered out at the break, raced off the rail on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. THE CLOWN stalked four wide on the first turn, raced close into the backstretch and gave chase approaching the three eighths pole but faded in the three path of the far turn. MEXICAN KRYPTONITE broke a step slow, raced erratically early and dropped well back.

ENTRY.NAME: Booyah
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace,met near 5/16,chased,flattened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Ragtime Riches
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,closed from 3/8,up 2d mid turn,clear later yds

ENTRY.NAME: Major Nelson
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,off rail 1st turn,little response

ENTRY.NAME: Mexican Kryptonite
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow break,erratic early,dropped well back

ENTRY.NAME: Iceteca
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled break,saved ground,chased 3/8,3p far turn,passed rivals

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 19 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Al lowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MATH MAN MARCO engaged in close chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and dueled clear the final yards. DERBY DAY DREAMS chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, angled out mid-stretch and dug in to take the nod for second the final strides. NICHIREN chased, raced two deep on the turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. AMIDSHIPS was hustled to the front approaching the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, contested the edge at the rail on the turn, dug in from the eighth pole but was caught mid-stretch and weakened late yards. SHOWTIME CAT pressured the pace approaching the three eighths pole, contested the turn two deep then flattened stride in the lane. ROCKET APPEAL gave chase, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane. MYSTIC O'SHAUNESIE dropped well back early. BRION gave chase outside and rounded the turn about the six path. COLLEGE KID chased inside, faded at the rail on the turn, showed no response leaving the turn, was eased up past the eighth pole but limped to the wire.

ENTRY.NAME: College Kid
ENTRY.OWNER: Devane William E and King Adam
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,faded rail turn,no response,eased,limped to finish

ENTRY.NAME: Amidships
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to front,set pressured pace,edge rail turn,weakened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 30500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 19 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 19 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12, 500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STROLLINGINTHEWIND settled two deep on the first turn, started his bid leaving the half mile pole and steadily gained, rounded the far turn in the three path, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and drew clear later yards. LUCKY ONE took over at the rail and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole but was met mid-stretch and flattened the final sixteenth. GATTO BE PROUD rounded the opening turn about the five path, left the turn outside and gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn then flattened in the lane. O'RIGSBY saved ground, gave chase leaving the nine sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and passed rivals in the lane. DON'TCALLTOOEARLY saved ground racing well back, gave chase toward the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and passed rivals in the lane. OFFICER STONE rated close in the three path the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three and four paths on the far turn but showed little more. RIVER MALBUMOONRVF stalked two deep the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but flattened at the rail on the far turn. I'M THE MONEY MAN rated close in the four path the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path then weakened. PINNACLE REEF settled off the rail on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. JUST A FLIRT stalked the early pace two deep, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Officer Stone
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close 3p,chased 7/16,3& 4p far turn,little in lane
